CreateApp.name: CreateApp
CreateApp.documentation: Creates an application. An application consists of one or more server groups. Each server group contain one or more servers.

CreateReplicationJob.name: CreateReplicationJob
CreateReplicationJob.documentation: Creates a replication job. The replication job schedules periodic replication runs to replicate your server to Amazon Web Services. Each replication run creates an Amazon Machine Image (AMI).

DeleteApp.name: DeleteApp
DeleteApp.documentation: Deletes the specified application. Optionally deletes the launched stack associated with the application and all Server Migration Service replication jobs for servers in the application.

DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration.name: DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration
DeleteAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Deletes the launch configuration for the specified application.

DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration.name: DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration
DeleteAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Deletes the replication configuration for the specified application.

DeleteAppValidationConfiguration.name: DeleteAppValidationConfiguration
DeleteAppValidationConfiguration.documentation: Deletes the validation configuration for the specified application.

DeleteReplicationJob.name: DeleteReplicationJob
DeleteReplicationJob.documentation:
Deletes the specified replication job.

After you delete a replication job, there are no further replication runs. Amazon Web Services deletes the contents of the Amazon S3 bucket used to store Server Migration Service artifacts. The AMIs created by the replication runs are not deleted.

DeleteServerCatalog.name: DeleteServerCatalog
DeleteServerCatalog.documentation: Deletes all servers from your server catalog.

DisassociateConnector.name: DisassociateConnector
DisassociateConnector.documentation:
Disassociates the specified connector from Server Migration Service.

After you disassociate a connector, it is no longer available to support replication jobs.

GenerateChangeSet.name: GenerateChangeSet
GenerateChangeSet.documentation: Generates a target change set for a currently launched stack and writes it to an Amazon S3 object in the customer’s Amazon S3 bucket.

GenerateTemplate.name: GenerateTemplate
GenerateTemplate.documentation: Generates an CloudFormation template based on the current launch configuration and writes it to an Amazon S3 object in the customer’s Amazon S3 bucket.

GetAppLaunchConfiguration.name: GetAppLaunchConfiguration
GetAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves the application launch configuration associated with the specified application.

GetAppReplicationConfiguration.name: GetAppReplicationConfiguration
GetAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves the application replication configuration associated with the specified application.

GetAppValidationConfiguration.name: GetAppValidationConfiguration
GetAppValidationConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves information about a configuration for validating an application.

GetConnectors.name: GetConnectors
GetConnectors.documentation: Describes the connectors registered with the Server Migration Service.

GetReplicationJobs.name: GetReplicationJobs
GetReplicationJobs.documentation: Describes the specified replication job or all of your replication jobs.

GetReplicationRuns.name: GetReplicationRuns
GetReplicationRuns.documentation: Describes the replication runs for the specified replication job.

GetServers.name: GetServers
GetServers.documentation:
Describes the servers in your server catalog.

Before you can describe your servers, you must import them using ImportServerCatalog.

ImportServerCatalog.name: ImportServerCatalog
ImportServerCatalog.documentation:
Gathers a complete list of on-premises servers. Connectors must be installed and monitoring all servers to import.

This call returns immediately, but might take additional time to retrieve all the servers.

LaunchApp.name: LaunchApp
LaunchApp.documentation: Launches the specified application as a stack in CloudFormation.

NotifyAppValidationOutput.name: NotifyAppValidationOutput
NotifyAppValidationOutput.documentation: Provides information to Server Migration Service about whether application validation is successful.

PutAppLaunchConfiguration.name: PutAppLaunchConfiguration
PutAppLaunchConfiguration.documentation: Creates or updates the launch configuration for the specified application.

PutAppReplicationConfiguration.name: PutAppReplicationConfiguration
PutAppReplicationConfiguration.documentation: Creates or updates the replication configuration for the specified application.

PutAppValidationConfiguration.name: PutAppValidationConfiguration
PutAppValidationConfiguration.documentation: Creates or updates a validation configuration for the specified application.

StartAppReplication.name: StartAppReplication
StartAppReplication.documentation: Starts replicating the specified application by creating replication jobs for each server in the application.

StartOnDemandAppReplication.name: StartOnDemandAppReplication
StartOnDemandAppReplication.documentation: Starts an on-demand replication run for the specified application.

StartOnDemandReplicationRun.name: StartOnDemandReplicationRun
StartOnDemandReplicationRun.documentation:
Starts an on-demand replication run for the specified replication job. This replication run starts immediately. This replication run is in addition to the ones already scheduled.

There is a limit on the number of on-demand replications runs that you can request in a 24-hour period.

StopAppReplication.name: StopAppReplication
StopAppReplication.documentation: Stops replicating the specified application by deleting the replication job for each server in the application.

TerminateApp.name: TerminateApp
TerminateApp.documentation: Terminates the stack for the specified application.

UpdateReplicationJob.name: UpdateReplicationJob
UpdateReplicationJob.documentation: Updates the specified settings for the specified replication job.

statusMessage.documentation: A message related to the status of the application

replicationStatusMessage.documentation: A message related to the replication status of the application.

latestReplicationTime.documentation: The timestamp of the application's most recent successful replication.

launchStatusMessage.documentation: A message related to the launch status of the application.

launchDetails.documentation: Details about the latest launch of the application.

lastModified.documentation: The last modified time of the application.

roleName.documentation: The name of the service role in the customer's account used by Server Migration Service.

totalServerGroups.documentation: The number of server groups present in the application.

totalServers.documentation: The number of servers present in the application.

ssmOutput.documentation: Output from using SSM to validate the application.

roleName.documentation: The name of the service role in the customer's account to be used by Server Migration Service.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of application creation.

serverGroups.documentation: The server groups to include in the application.

tags.documentation: The tags to be associated with the application.

serverGroups.documentation: The server groups included in the application.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

runOnce.documentation: Indicates whether to run the replication job one time.

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by the Server Migration Service.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The maximum number of SMS-created AMIs to retain. The oldest is deleted after the maximum number is reached and a new AMI is created.

encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the replication job produces encrypted AMIs.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to the KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to the KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

replicationJobId.documentation: The unique identifier of the replication job.

forceStopAppReplication.documentation: Indicates whether to stop all replication jobs corresponding to the servers in the application while deleting the application.

forceTerminateApp.documentation: Indicates whether to terminate the stack corresponding to the application while deleting the application.

DryRunOperationException.documentation: The user has the required permissions, so the request would have succeeded, but a dry run was performed.

appId.documentation: The ID of the application associated with the change set.

s3Location.documentation: The location of the Amazon S3 object.

appId.documentation: The ID of the application associated with the CloudFormation template.

templateFormat.documentation: The format for generating the CloudFormation template.

s3Location.documentation: The location of the Amazon S3 object.

roleName.documentation: The name of the service role in the customer's account that CloudFormation uses to launch the application.

autoLaunch.documentation: Indicates whether the application is configured to launch automatically after replication is complete.

serverGroupLaunchConfigurations.documentation: The launch configurations for server groups in this application.

serverGroupReplicationConfigurations.documentation: The replication configurations associated with server groups in this application.

serverGroups.documentation: The server groups that belong to the application.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
The token for the next set of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
The token for the next set of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
The token for the next set of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 50. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

lastModifiedOn.documentation: The time when the server was last modified.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

roleName.documentation: The name of the service role. If you omit this parameter, we create a service-linked role for Migration Hub in your account. Otherwise, the role that you provide must have the policy and trust policy described in the Migration Hub User Guide.

latestLaunchTime.documentation: The latest time that this application was launched successfully.

stackName.documentation: The name of the latest stack launched for this application.

stackId.documentation: The ID of the latest stack launched for this application.

LaunchDetails.documentation: Details about the latest launch of an application.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. The default value is 100. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

nextToken.documentation: The token required to retrieve the next set of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

NotificationContext.documentation: Contains the status of validating an application.

roleName.documentation: The name of service role in the customer's account that CloudFormation uses to launch the application.

autoLaunch.documentation: Indicates whether the application is configured to launch automatically after replication is complete.

serverGroupLaunchConfigurations.documentation: Information about the launch configurations for server groups in the application.

serverGroupReplicationConfigurations.documentation: Information about the replication configurations for server groups in the application.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

runOnce.documentation: Indicates whether to run the replication job one time.

nextReplicationRunStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by Server Migration Service.

latestAmiId.documentation: The ID of the latest Amazon Machine Image (AMI).

statusMessage.documentation: The description of the current status of the replication job.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The number of recent AMIs to keep in the customer's account for a replication job. By default, the value is set to zero, meaning that all AMIs are kept.

encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the replication job should produce encrypted AMIs.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to the KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to the KMS key alias

If encrypted is enabled but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

ReplicationJobNotFoundException.documentation: The specified replication job does not exist.

stageDetails.documentation: Details about the current stage of the replication run.

statusMessage.documentation: The description of the current status of the replication job.

amiId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) from the replication run.

scheduledStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

completedTime.documentation: The completion time of the last replication run.

encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the replication run should produce an encrypted AMI.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to the KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to the KMS key alias

If encrypted is true but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

ReplicationRunLimitExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded the number of on-demand replication runs you can request in a 24-hour period.

stage.documentation: The current stage of a replication run.

stageProgress.documentation: The progress of the current stage of a replication run.

ReplicationRunStageDetails.documentation: Details of the current stage of a replication run.

instanceId.documentation: The ID of the instance. The instance must have the following tag: UserForSMSApplicationValidation=true.

command.documentation: The command to run the validation script.

outputS3BucketName.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket for output.

replicationJobTerminated.documentation: Indicates whether the replication job is deleted or failed.

serverList.documentation: The servers that belong to a server group.

serverGroupId.documentation: The ID of the server group with which the launch configuration is associated.

launchOrder.documentation: The launch order of servers in the server group.

serverLaunchConfigurations.documentation: The launch configuration for servers in the server group.

serverGroupId.documentation: The ID of the server group with which this replication configuration is associated.

serverReplicationConfigurations.documentation: The replication configuration for servers in the server group.

server.documentation: The ID of the server with which the launch configuration is associated.

logicalId.documentation: The logical ID of the server in the CloudFormation template.

vpc.documentation: The ID of the VPC into which the server should be launched.

subnet.documentation: The ID of the subnet the server should be launched into.

securityGroup.documentation: The ID of the security group that applies to the launched server.

ec2KeyName.documentation: The name of the Amazon EC2 SSH key to be used for connecting to the launched server.

userData.documentation: Location of the user-data script to be executed when launching the server.

instanceType.documentation: The instance type to use when launching the server.

associatePublicIpAddress.documentation: Indicates whether a publicly accessible IP address is created when launching the server.

iamInstanceProfileName.documentation: The name of the IAM instance profile.

server.documentation: The ID of the server with which this replication configuration is associated.

seedTime.documentation: The seed time for creating a replication job for the server.

frequency.documentation: The frequency of creating replication jobs for the server.

runOnce.documentation: Indicates whether to run the replication job one time.

licenseType.documentation: The license type for creating a replication job for the server.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The number of recent AMIs to keep when creating a replication job for this server.

encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the replication job produces encrypted AMIs.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to the KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to the KMS key alias

If encrypted is enabled but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

ServerReplicationParameters.documentation: The replication parameters for replicating a server.

Source.documentation: Contains the location of a validation script.

Tag.documentation: Key/value pair that can be assigned to an application.

UnauthorizedOperationException.documentation: You lack permissions needed to perform this operation. Check your IAM policies, and ensure that you are using the correct access keys.

roleName.documentation: The name of the service role in the customer's account used by Server Migration Service.

serverGroups.documentation: The server groups in the application to update.

tags.documentation: The tags to associate with the application.

serverGroups.documentation: The updated server groups in the application.

frequency.documentation: The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

nextReplicationRunStartTime.documentation: The start time of the next replication run.

licenseType.documentation: The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

roleName.documentation: The name of the IAM role to be used by Server Migration Service.

numberOfRecentAmisToKeep.documentation: The maximum number of SMS-created AMIs to retain. The oldest is deleted after the maximum number is reached and a new AMI is created.

encrypted.documentation: When true, the replication job produces encrypted AMIs. For more information, KmsKeyId.

kmsKeyId.documentation:
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:

  • KMS key ID

  • KMS key alias

  • ARN referring to the KMS key ID

  • ARN referring to the KMS key alias

If encrypted is enabled but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

s3Location.documentation: Amazon S3 location of the user-data script.

UserData.documentation: A script that runs on first launch of an Amazon EC2 instance. Used for configuring the server during launch.

latestValidationTime.documentation: The latest time that the validation was performed.

vmPath.documentation: The VM folder path in the vCenter Server virtual machine inventory tree.

documentation:
Product update

We recommend Amazon Web Services Application Migration Service (Amazon Web Services MGN) as the primary migration service for lift-and-shift migrations. If Amazon Web Services MGN is unavailable in a specific Amazon Web Services Region, you can use the Server Migration Service APIs through March 2023.

Server Migration Service (Server Migration Service) makes it easier and faster for you to migrate your on-premises workloads to Amazon Web Services. To learn more about Server Migration Service, see the following resources:

  • Server Migration Service product page

  • Server Migration Service User Guide
